news_header: A French convict, Mohamed Amra, was arrested in Romania after escaping a deadly ambush that killed two prison officers.
news_original_title: French prisoner 'The Fly' arrested nine months after deadly van ambush
news_text: Mohamed Amra, a French convict linked to a drug gang, was arrested in Romania after escaping from a police van during a deadly ambush in May 2024, which resulted in the deaths of two prison officers. French President Emmanuel Macron praised the capture as a significant success and expressed condolences to the victims' families. Amra had altered his appearance to evade capture, but was identified through facial recognition and fingerprints. Following his arrest, ten individuals suspected of aiding his escape were also detained. The ambush, which occurred near Rouen, marked a tragic event in French prison history, being the first officer fatalities since 1992. Macron thanked European partners and investigators for their efforts in the manhunt.
